meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>destroy</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to be destroyed</vocabulary>. You know you're not destroying things because of the <reading>beer</reading> (びる). You'd never destroy beer... but someone else might. Grrr.
readingMnemonic: "THE <reading>HORROR</reading>!" (ほろ) you cry, as your beer is about <vocabulary>to be destroyed</vocabulary>.
